conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relative positions of objects and light source.
Light source is positioned such that shadows are cast in the direction shown in the image.
Light source moving to the back right means light rays will come from a direction more towards the back right of the objects.
Shadows will shift towards the front left because shadows are cast in the opposite direction of the light source.
Size of shadows will depend on the angle of light rays; if light source moves further away, shadows may become larger due to increased angle of incidence.
Shadow A (Cake) will move towards the front left and may become larger.
Shadow B (Spoon) will move towards the front left and may become larger.
Shadow C (Bandage Roll) will shift towards the front left and may become larger.
Shadow D (Ring) will move towards the front left and may become larger.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left and may become larger due to increased angle of incidence.
